name: Energetic
description: We’ll help you recharge and feel full of energy.
imagine: Imagine awakening your body and mind, ready to conquer the day.
helpYou: will help you activate your body, increase focus, and boost motivation.

relaxBody.title: Energizing activation exercises
relaxBody.description: Wake up your body and prepare for action with dynamic movements.
relaxBody.repeatIn: In {{seconds}} seconds you can repeat these exercises.

exercises.name: On-the-spot jumps
exercises.instructions: Do small jumps, maintaining a steady pace for 30 seconds. Keep your arms relaxed or move them in sync with the jumps.

exercises.name: Arm circles
exercises.instructions: Rotate your arms forward in wide circles for 20 seconds, then reverse direction backward for another 20 seconds.

exercises.name: Dynamic squats
exercises.instructions: Bend your knees to 90° and rise quickly, keeping your back straight. Repeat for 30 seconds.

exercises.name: Torso twists
exercises.instructions: Stand with feet slightly apart and arms bent in front of your chest. Gently rotate your torso right and left, keeping hips steady. Continue for 30 seconds.

journalGoals.prompt: Write 3 goals you want to achieve today and how you'll do it!

goals.prompt: Write down 3 goals for today and how you plan to achieve them!

journalPost.prompt: Tell us how you feel after the session. It will help you track its effects.

spiritual.text: Energy is contagious. Be a source of enthusiasm and inspire those around you.

environment.suggestion: Open the windows, take a deep breath, and immerse yourself in the sounds to start your day energized.
environment.title: Energizing environment

coach.intro: You will learn how to overcome common obstacles while staying motivated and focused.
coach.finished: Path completed! You managed {{score}} out of {{total}} situations effectively.
coach.noSteps: No coaching path available for this mood.

steps.situation: You wake up tired and unmotivated to start the day.

options.text: I do 2 minutes of jumps and play an energetic track.
I stay in bed scrolling on my phone a bit more.

feedback.correct: Great! Movement and music can wake up the body instantly.
feedback.wrong: Understandable, but a small active gesture can quickly change your energy.

steps.situation: You have a to-do list but feel unmotivated.

options.text: I write 3 goals and link them to an immediate action.
I avoid thinking about it and do something random instead.

feedback.correct: Writing down goals activates your mental focus.
feedback.wrong: Starting without direction can drain energy unnecessarily.

steps.situation: You get distracted easily while working.

options.text: I stand up, do 30 seconds of squats, then get back to work.
I keep struggling with distractions without stopping.

feedback.correct: Great strategy. Re-activating your body helps focus.
feedback.wrong: Sometimes a quick active break is all you need to refocus.

options.text: I read the motivational quote again and remember my ‘why’.
I dwell on it and start doubting myself.

feedback.correct: Good! Keeping your vision alive gives you strength.
feedback.wrong: Don’t let your energy be dimmed by others. Stay focused on your purpose.

steps.situation: You’re short on time before something important.

options.text: At least 1 minute of rapid breathing to boost myself.
I do nothing—it’s too late anyway.

feedback.correct: Even 1 minute can spark your energy.
feedback.wrong: Don’t underestimate the power of a few focused seconds.

steps.situation: Your environment is dull and unstimulating.

options.text: I play my energetic playlist and open the windows.
I adapt, even if I feel down.

feedback.correct: You've created the right environment to unleash energy.

steps.situation: You started off with enthusiasm, but now your energy is fading.

options.text: I take an active break to reignite my body.
I ignore the slump and push through while getting more tired.

feedback.correct: Great insight! Active breaks restore energy.
feedback.wrong: You’ll handle energy drops better with a quick reset.

steps.situation: You’ve done a lot, but still feel something’s missing.

options.text: I write down my progress in the journal for motivation.
I immediately move to the next thing without pause.

feedback.wrong: Appreciating what you’ve done gives you more energy than you think.

steps.situation: You feel alone in your energy and no one understands you.

options.text: I reflect on the quote and the inner strength I have.
I suppress my energy and isolate myself.

feedback.correct: Connecting to a deeper strength keeps your energy alive.
feedback.wrong: Don’t dim yourself—channel your energy where it matters.

steps.situation: The session is over but you’re unsure it really helped.

options.text: I write in the journal how I feel now versus before.
I just close everything and go on with my day as if nothing happened.

feedback.wrong: Don’t let it all go unnoticed. Reflection gives meaning.
